intro: Hieracium cerinthiforme, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, yellowish-green stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow ray florets and a central disk of tubular flowers. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. It is considered a perennial herb that spreads through rhizomes and is sometimes found in gardens and along roadsides.
